9800.title: The Marauder's Shrine
9800.description:
Every part of this room is made out of a pure, unstained onyx.
Even the lightest noise made can be heard echoing slightly,
bouncing off the reflecting surface of the walls. No torches or
lights shine in this room. A black glow lights up this room,
and it emanates from the onyx statue in the middle of the room.

9801.title: Corridor
9801.description:
The floor of this room is a little more than packed dirt beneath
one's feet. Loose pieces of gravel and dirt look as if they
could still be scattered about by a sliding foot. Light can be
seen coming from within a rather large doorway. A low murmur of
voices and other jovial sounds can be heard from within. Torches
are constantly burning in their golden sconces upon the walls.

9802.title: Entry Hall
9802.description:
Footsteps echo loudly in this hall of carved marble. It has been
constructed so seamlessly that it looks to have been carved
from one solid piece of white marble. There are no torches
burning in this hall, but a light seems to echo like a voice off
the walls.

9803.title: An Intersection
9803.description:
Four different halls branch out of this room. One leads back
towards the entrance and to the hall of white marble. One leads
to the north; out of that path comes the smell of alcohol and
cooking meat. A ladder leads up into a hole in the ceiling;
flickering shadows can be seen crossing across the hole. To the
south there is the sound of silence. No movement, no talking, no
activity of any kind comes from there.

9804.title: Dining Hall
9804.description:
Beyond the archway to this room, the ceiling expands upward
for several feet. The walls widen out to accommodate the tables
set up in rows across half of the floor. The other half of the
room appears to be a very busy kitchen. A fire is burning in an
oversized fireplace, perfectly sized for the massive pot that is
in it. Tables with various kitchen utensils surround the
remainder of the kitchen.

9805.title: Closet
9805.description:
The walls of this small room are very smooth and unadorned. A
pile of rags can be seen in one corner, the smells of soap and
murky water wafting up from them. A large rug covers the portion
of the floor on the opposite side of the room from the rags. It
is not a very comfortable place.

9806.title: Hall
9806.description:
The grains of the wood-panelled walls of this hallway make
patterns that seem to dance in the flickering torchlight. There
are niches in the sides of the hall for people to stand out of
the way if they wish to converse in the hall. There is a hole
in the floor with a ladder running down into the room below; a
large doorway sits in front of a room to the east, and the hall
continues to the north.

9807.title: The Vault
9807.description:
The stairs descending into this vault are made of the same
unbroken white marble that is in the main hallway. The swirls
and patterns of the marble suddenly stop as the stairs meet
the floor. The walls of the room are lined with lockers and
indentations, places to store the wealth of the Marauders.

9808.title: The Thug's Den
9808.description:
Not very good care has been given to this room from the looks of
it. The covering of the walls seems to be falling off in spots;
the floor is a complete mess covered in pieces of random clothing
and bedding items. There are various beds of different sizes
lining the walls.  Some seem to be made for those of giant
stature and others look like a gnome or halfling would fit
snugly under the blankets.

9809.title: Hall
9809.description:
A grand archway leads to a room to the end of this hallway. It
is covered with a thick black velvet drape. A path has been
worn into the floor and it leads down a narrow hallway to the
west. Torches line the hall way here, but no flames dance at
their ends, but rather a strange amber tinted light comes out
from where the flames should be.

9810.title: The Guildmaster's Den
9810.description:
A lavish looking bed is in the center of this room. It is round
and is covered with the furs and hides of exotic animals. It
looks very comfortable. Book shelves line the far wall, taking
up the walls surrounding the bed. The floor is covered with a
thick weaved carpet, looking like it would be fitting to hang
upon the wall of a king's castle as a most cherished tapestry.
A solid oak desk sits in the corner. Resting next to it is a
chair covered with leather and padded with stuffing which looks
much better than the rickety pine chair sitting across from it.

9811.title: Narrow Hallway
9811.description:
This hallway is a little more than a walk-in closet. A human can
stand in the center of the hallway and reach out and touch both
walls. The only light in this hallway comes from the open hall
to the east and from the stairway at the end of the hall. The
stairs are very steep; one would want to be cautious when going
down them.

9812.title: The Godfathers Abode
9812.description:
This overlook, erected high into the upper limits of the house,
was created so the Godfather could oversee the businesses.  The
room is rather small and dim, with an iron fireplace burning
in the back of the room.  On the walls, there are a few posters
depicting wanted criminals, and a few of Lord Rellion's enemies.
In the center of the room rests a small table, surrounded by
two wooden chairs.  On the top of the table rests a few accounting
books, each with the balances of the Marauder house account penned
in them.
